intro: Siphocampylus tupaeformis, commonly known as the velvetleaf siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
